title: COOKING CONTROL DEVICE, COOKING CONTROL SYSTEM AND COMPUTER PROGRAM PRODUCT
abstract: The present invention relates to a cooking control device that comprises sensors (120) and a communication unit (145) to communicate with a display processing device (170). In this manner, taste values of the cooking substance reflecting the current status of the cooking process can be compared with pre-stored taste values representative of a desired cooking result and seasoning advice according to a recipe can be established and presented to a user to converge the cooking status with the desired cooking result.

motivations: There is a need for real-time monitoring and control of cooking processes to achieve desired results.
Users require guidance on seasoning and adjusting cooking parameters to match pre-defined recipes.
objectives: Develop a cooking control device that integrates sensors and communication capabilities to monitor and adjust cooking processes.
Provide users with real-time seasoning advice and guidance to achieve desired cooking results based on pre-stored recipes.
methods: Utilize sensors to monitor the cooking process and communicate with a display processing device.
Compare real-time taste values with pre-stored values to generate seasoning advice and adjust cooking parameters.
results: Enable users to achieve consistent and desired cooking results through real-time monitoring and guidance.
Enhance the cooking experience by providing personalized seasoning advice and adjustments.

motivations: There is a need for a system that can monitor the cooking process and provide real-time feedback to achieve desired taste results.
Current cooking methods may not always yield the desired taste, indicating a need for a more controlled and guided approach.
objectives: Develop a cooking control device that uses sensors and communication units to monitor and guide the cooking process.
Provide real-time seasoning advice to users based on the comparison of current and desired taste values.
methods: Use sensors to monitor the taste values of the cooking substance during the cooking process.
Compare the current taste values with pre-stored taste values representative of a desired cooking result.
Establish and present seasoning advice to the user through a communication unit and display processing device.
results: Enable users to achieve desired cooking results by providing real-time feedback and seasoning advice.
Improve the consistency and quality of cooking outcomes by converging the cooking status with the desired result.

motivations: Cooking outcomes often deviate from desired results due to lack of real-time feedback on taste parameters during the cooking process.
Home cooks need guidance to adjust seasonings and achieve recipe-specific taste profiles.
objectives: Develop a cooking control system that monitors taste values in real-time and compares them with target values for desired cooking results.
Provide automated seasoning advice to help users achieve recipe-specific taste profiles.
methods: Utilize sensors to measure taste values of cooking substances during the cooking process.
Implement a communication system between the cooking control device and a display processing device to present real-time feedback and recommendations.
results: Enable users to achieve more consistent and desired cooking results through real-time taste monitoring and guidance.
Improve cooking outcomes by providing automated seasoning adjustments based on sensor data and recipe requirements.
